init_text:
Is It Selfish to Pursue Risky Sports Like Extreme Mountain Climbing?

Some sports, like extreme mountain climbing, are dangerous. Since there are varying degrees of risk in most, if not all, sports (such as the possibility of concussions, broken bones and even death), how does one decide where the line might be drawn between what is reasonable and what is not? Are some sports simply too dangerous to be called a sport?

---

In my opinion,

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: I am not saying sports athletes are not brave, but I think some sports athletes would try to do something that would guarantee harm.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: There are four main questions to consider when trying to pull something from being a sport: the athlete, the competitor, spectators and equipment.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: It is the intention that makes the sport, not the consequences.

actions.text: if something should be considered a sport or not.

actions.text: In my opinion, parkour and skateboarding is more about being cool more than it is a sport.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: The people who do a sport is also important.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: If a person is too risky and too ambitious, these are not the kinds of people who would end up in a sport.

actions.name: text-insert
actions.text: Sportsmen are not arrogant, and do not use violence.
